title: Another claims Homeland bias
body:
WASHINGTON - A third worker is backing up a top New York immigration cop's tale of anti-male bias at the 
Department of Homeland Security.

The new case alleges discrimination dating to 2007, two years before a lawsuit filed in May charges that DHS 
Secretary Janet Napolitano's staff turned U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement into a female "frat house."

Napolitano took over at Homeland Security in 2009.

The agency passed him over for his old boss' job in favor of a woman, the worker claims.

The affidavit, signed Thursday but released with the worker's name redacted, supports the earlier suit filed by 
James Hayes, special agent in charge of ICE's New York Field Office.
